data.title: 6 Unknown facts about Sardar Udham Singh
data.meta_description: 6 facts about Udham Singh on his 81st death anniversary, the freedom fighter who was hanged on 31 July 1940 for assassinating General Michael Oâ€™Dwyer who was responsible for Jallianwala Bagh massacre.
data.text:
Udham Singh became the immortal figure of the Indian Independence Movement and was referred as Shaheed-i-Azam Sardar Udham Singh

After killing M.O'Dwyer, Udham Singh adopted the name Ram Mohammad Singh Azad, representing the unity of three major religions in India

While awaiting his trial, Singh went on a 42-day hunger strike and had to be forcibly fed. Singh was hanged at Pentonville Prison on 31 July 1940

His mortal remains were handed over to India in 1974 and are kept at Jallianwala Bagh in Amritsar.
